subject: Medicine
title: The Hippocampus
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Hippocampus.

hook.text: A seahorse-shaped structure deep in your brain is the gateway to all your memories. Lose it and you can't form new ones.

buildup.text: The hippocampus converts experiences into long-term memories and helps with spatial navigation.

discovery.text: It doesn't store memories permanentlyâ€”it transfers them to the cortex over weeks and months.

twist.text: People with hippocampal damage can't imagine the future eitherâ€”memory and imagination share the same hardware.

climax.text: The hippocampus is one of the first areas damaged in Alzheimer's disease, explaining early memory loss.

punchline.text: A seahorse in your head builds your past and future.

quiz.question: Why can't people with hippocampal damage imagine the future?
options: Memory and imagination share the same brain hardware
The hippocampus controls all creative thinking
Future planning is stored in the hippocampus permanently
